intro: Pavetta limbata, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. Pavetta limbata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
